DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Nuclei Percent Fulfill The Cancer Genome Atlas Metric Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not the malignant sample submitted meets the current tumor nuclei metrics for TCGA.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Nucleus Percentage Fulfill The Cancer Genome Atlas Submission Requirement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Within a eukaryotic cell, a membrane-limited body which contains chromosomes and one or more nucleoli (CELL NUCLEOLUS). The nuclear membrane consists of a double unit-type membrane which is perforated by a number of pores; the outermost membrane is continuous with the ENDOPLASMIC RETICULUM. A cell may contain more than one nucleus. (From Singleton & Sainsbury, Dictionary of Microbiology and Molecular Biology, 2d ed)_Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of._A comprehensive and coordinated effort to accelerate understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of genome analysis technologies, including large-scale genome sequencing. This project is a joint effort of the National Cancer Institute and the National Human Genome Research Institute. (http://cancergenome.nih.gov/abouttcga)_Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others._Requirement; something that is necessary.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredName: Nucleus Percentage Fulfill The Cancer Genome Atlas Submission Requirement
Property.preferredDefinition: Within a eukaryotic cell, a membrane-limited body which contains chromosomes and one or more nucleoli (CELL NUCLEOLUS). The nuclear membrane consists of a double unit-type membrane which is perforated by a number of pores; the outermost membrane is continuous with the ENDOPLASMIC RETICULUM. A cell may contain more than one nucleus. (From Singleton & Sainsbury, Dictionary of Microbiology and Molecular Biology, 2d ed):Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.:A comprehensive and coordinated effort to accelerate understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of genome analysis technologies, including large-scale genome sequencing. This project is a joint effort of the National Cancer Institute and the National Human Genome Research Institute. (http://cancergenome.nih.gov/abouttcga):Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.:Requirement; something that is necessary.

Concepts.definition: A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

A comprehensive and coordinated effort to accelerate understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of genome analysis technologies, including large-scale genome sequencing. This project is a joint effort of the National Cancer Institute and the National Human Genome Research Institute. (http://cancergenome.nih.gov/abouttcga)
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
